instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message: No liquid damage, its detecting battery in About. I always seem to replace <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> but my question is "how to tell if it is in fact the ISL?" any help is much appreciated thanks in advance.

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message: Known good battery? Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message:
When OSX detects battery, first step is testing known good battery.
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and run ASD EFI.

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message: can someone please share the BRD. i purchased the pdf but no brd was available.

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message: Maybe, if you post 820-xxxx code of your board...

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thanks for any support given

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message:

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message: Fair warning this will have a dead GPU tomorrow so yeah

threads.title: 2010 MBP works but doesnt charge the battery.
threads.message:
Thanks for the BRD. here is the conclusion.

<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area was fucked. looks like someone gave it a good blowjob with an hot air gun on hi flow and blew shit everywhere. resistor where a cap was supposed to be and so on. dare i say the original fault all along was probably the battery. out of 6 batteries i had they were all broken lol. i tested it with a 13" battery and what do ya know??? it started charging. 

Thanks once again, this job is done! as for the failing GPU whos gives a daam, some customers love thier shit so much they will literally use it to the death. so long as they are aware of the issue then thats all thatr matters.
